Calculate a decision rule table for interim monitoring of a pre-specified design

calc_decision_rules.Rd

This function will take the posterior and predictive thresholds for a pre-specified design with a given null response rate and fixed interim looks and total sample size, and return the decision rules at each interim analysis and the end of the trial. Intended for use after selecting an optimal design using the functions calibrate_thresholds and optimize_design.

calc_decision_rules(
  n,
  N,
  theta,
  ppp,
  p0,
  direction = "greater",
  delta = NULL,
  prior = c(0.5, 0.5),
  S = 5000
)

Arguments

n

integer of sample size so far for one-sample case
N

tinteger of total planned sample size at end of trial N for one-sample case
theta

The target posterior probability. e.g. Efficacy decision if P(p > p0) > theta for the one-sample case with greater direction.
ppp

The target predictive probability. e.g. Stop the trial if the predictive probability falls below this target.
p0

The target value to compare to in the one-sample case (i.e. the null response rate)
direction

For one-sample case, "greater" if interest is in P(p > p0) and "less" if interest is in P(p < p0).
delta

clinically meaningful difference between groups. Typically 0 for two-sample case. NULL for one-sample case (default).
prior

hyperparameters of prior beta distribution. Beta(0.5, 0.5) is default
S

number of samples, default is 5000

Value

Returns a tibble with n at each look and r. Stop the trial at that look if the number of observed responses is <=r. At the end of the trial, the treatment is considered promising if the number of observed responses is >r.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
set.seed(123)

# One-sample case
calc_decision_rules(seq(5, 25, 5), p0 = 0.1, N = 25, theta = 0.86, ppp = 0.2)
}
